Structural vulnerabilities (household debt, crowded short volatility positioning, regulatory uncertainty) outweigh bullish catalysts (AI momentum, crypto infrastructure adoption, policy stimulus) that require longer timeframes to materialize.

ðŸ“ˆ **Themes:** (1) Policy uncertainty and regulatory tightening creating defensive positioning, (2) AI/semiconductor strength versus governance token obsolescence in crypto sector bifurcation, (3) Elevated volatility risk from crowded positioning and consumer debt stress at 2008-level ratios.

key_themes: Crypto sector bifurcation (infrastructure vs governance tokens)
Consumer debt stress and household leverage
risk_factors: Household debt service at 30% of disposable income (highest since 2008)
Short volatility positioning vulnerable to rapid unwinding
Governance token structural obsolescence versus equity-like instruments
Treasury yield pressure from policy stimulus creating fragile environment
Tariff policy uncertainty creating binary event risk
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY: $680 support (122k OI - ACTIVE), $693 resistance (52k OI - ACTIVE). QQQ: $610 support (83k OI - ACTIVE), $627 resistance (54k OI - ACTIVE). Watch for volatility expansion given crowded short vol positioning.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Test of $680 support likely, break below targets $640 zone (101k OI). Resistance at $701 (52k OI), then dormant Call Wall $750. QQQ: $610 key support, downside to $580 zone if breaks. Resistance at $630-$641 Call Wall (55k OI). Expect 3-5% correction per Twitter analysis before potential stabilization.
